subject: Read persistent triggers from storage
commitMessage:
Read persistent triggers from storage

Read json storage file for persistent triggers.
Add trigger to telemetry service.
Cover code with UTs.

Tested:
  - Passed unit tests
  - Tested on QEMU
    * starting app without configuration
    * restart app with configuration stored
    * restart app with configuration in incorrect version
    * restart app with configuration malformed

Change-Id: I2cb9324abdb8323be8a7f0c932ed7f70c5bc2891
Signed-off-by: Cezary Zwolak <cezary.zwolak@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Lukasz Kazmierczak <lukasz.kazmierczak@intel.com>

Change has been successfully merged by Krzysztof Grobelny
auto, type is already present on right side
*.bak file, delete it and add rule to exclude *.bak files in .gitignore
What if load return empty optional? You never check that.
Upgrade of telemetry-service can cause this error, it means it is runtime_error not logic_error.
Seems to be not used anywhere.
You can remove this test. It is 100% covered in triggerManagerCtorAddProperRemoveInvalidTriggerFromStorage.
nit: How about userId1? There is no harm if we add some extra information in tests, we can avoid jumping that way.
Not needed comparing to the rest of tests names, dropping.
This is used few times here, maybe specify this alias globally for this file, after #include section?
The statement repeated three times within the file, to be improved.

Can we move those conversion methods and classes to separate file? I would suggest:
- src/types/types.hpp / .cpp
- src/utils/conversion.hpp
- create new dedicated file inside utils or types dir.
Let's discuss on telco, and if agreed I will implement.
If you decide to move above conversion methods, move those too, see my previous comment.
This is used few times here, maybe specify this alias globally for this file, after #include section?
Same as previously, to be improved.
It looks like it is only used in line 268 which is different TestTriggerStore.

IMO it is good to keep it here though - Trigger elements are grouped by theirs type and so it is more consistent and likely easier to locate them using this layout.
It is also a good entry point for extending some of TestTrigger tests by units that cover discrete parameters, i.e.: please check test 'checkIfPropertiesAreSet' which can be extended or split to verify property of discrete threshold.
After discussion - the code will be updated based on Krzysztof's remark.
